result.markdown: --- author: Sam White toc-title: Contents toc-depth: 5 toc-location: left title: qPCRs - C.gigas Lifestage Carryover cDNA date: '2024-03-25' draft: false engine: knitr categories: - "qPCR" - "SsoFast" - "CFX Connect" - "HSP70" - "HSP90" - "GAPDH" - "VIPERIN" - "ATPsynthase" - "cGAS" - "DMNT1" - "citrate synthase" - "Crassostrea gigas" - "Pacific oyster" - "cDNA" --- # INTRO Ran qPCRs on the cDNA I made [last week](../2024-03-19-Reverse-Transcription---C.gigas-Lifestage-Carryover-Seed-and-Spat/) (Notebook), as part of the [`project-gigas-carryover`](../../../../project-gigas-carryover/lifestage_carryover/) (GitHub Repo). This file provides metadata for the samples being qPCR'd: - [20240314_rna_extractions.csv](https://github.com/RobertsLab/project-gigas-carryover/blob/82f1a4bcd5e2ce80cea9916f271bf1d54f740bd1/lifestage_carryover/data/sampling_metadata/20240314_rna_extractions.csv) (GitHub; commit: `82f1a4b`). ::: {.callout-note} Not all of the samples listed in the sheet above were used in the qPCRs, due to lack of RNA [during isolation](../2024-03-19-RNA-Isolation---C.gigas-Lifestage-Carryover-Seed-and-Spat/index.qmd) (Notebook). ::: The following primer sets were selected, based on previous usage in other stress (heat) experiments: | SR ID | Primer Name | |-------|----------------------| | 1385 | Cg_ATPsynthase_F | | 1386 | Cg_ATPsynthase_R | | 1383 | Cg_citratesynthase_F | | 1384 | Cg_citratesynthase_R | | 1172 | Cg_GAPDH_205_F | | 1173 | Cg_GAPDH_355_R | | 599 | Cg_HSP70_F | | 598 | Cg_HSP70_R | | 1532 | Cg_Hsp90_F | | 1533 | Cg_Hsp90_R | | 1829 | Cg_VIPERIN_F | | 1828 | Cg_VIPERIN_R | | 1827 | Cg_cGAS_F | | 1826 | Cg_cGAS_R | | 1510 | Cg_DNMT1_F | | 1511 | Cg_DNMT1_R | # MATERIALS & METHODS All samples were run in duplicate, on low-profile, white 96-well plates (USA Scientific) in a CFX Connect (BioRad) real-time thermalcycler. All reactions consisted of the following: | Component | Stock Concentration | Volume (uL) | |----------------------------------------------------|---------------------|-------------| | cDNA | NA | 1 | | SsoAdvanced Universal SYBR Green Supermix (BioRad) | 2x | 10 | | PF | 10uM | 0.5 | | PR | 10uM | 0.5 | | H2O | NA | 8 | | TOTAL | | 20 | For cycling parameters, plate layouts, etc. see the [RESULTS](#results) section below. Baseline threshold analysis was set to "Target" ("Fluorophore" is the default) in the CFX Maestro (BioRad) software for each plate. # RESULTS ## Summary - `ATP Synthase`: Amplification and melt plots look good. No amplification in NTCs. Reps are tight. - `HSP70`: Amplification and melt plots look good. No amplification in NTCs. Sample `244` has a _terrible_ set of reps (std. dev. of 4!!). All other reps are tight. - `GAPDH`: Amplification and melt plots look good. Range of ~2.00 Cqs is decent and probably permits usage as normalizing gene for this experiment. Late amplification in NTCs, but melt temp peak is noticeably lower than other amplicons. As such, this is not concerning. - `cGAS`: Amplification and melt plots look good. Late amplification in NTCs, but melt temp peak is ~2oC lower than other amplicons... Might be some non-specific amplification? Reps are tight. Reps are tight. - `HSP90`: Amplification and melt plots look good. No amplification in NTCs. Sample `223` reps are poor, but remainder are tight. - `VIPERIN`: Amplification and melt plots look good. Of note, amplification in `243` is noticeably later than all other samples. No amplification in NTCs. Most reps are tight, but samples `223` and `243` could be better... - `Citrate Synthase`: Amplification and melt plots look good. Of note, amplification in `243` is noticeably later than all other samples. No amplification in NTCs. Reps are tight. - `DNMT1`: Amplification and melt plots look good. No amplification in NTCs. Most reps are tight, but `296`, `298`, `223`, `243`, and `285` aren't great... ## Files ::: {.callout-tip} - `*.pdf`: qPCR Reports. Contains plate layouts, cycling params, amp/melt plots, etc. - `*Amplificaiton_Results*.csv`: Raw fluorescence data. - `*Cq_Results.csv`: Cycle quantity (Cq) data. - `*.pcrd`: Source qPCR data file. Requires CFX Maestro (BioRad) software to open. ::: ### ATP Synthase & HSP70 - [`sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54_Connect.pdf`](sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54_Connect.pdf) - [`sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54_Connect-Quantification-Amplification_Results-ATPsynthase.csv`](sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54_Connect-Quantification-Amplification_Results-ATPsynthase.csv) - [`sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54_Connect-Quantification-Amplification_Results-HSP70.csv`](sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54_Connect-Quantification-Amplification_Results-HSP70.csv) - [`sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54_Connect-Quantification-Cq_Results.csv`](sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54_Connect-Quantification-Cq_Results.csv) - [`sam_2024-03-25_10-33-37_Connect.pcrd`](https://owl.fish.washington.edu/scaphapoda/qPCR_data/cfx_connect_data/sam_2024-03-25_10-33-37_Connect.pcrd) ## Plots - Amplification and Melt Plots ::: {.callout-note} No Template Controls (NTCs) are denoted by red lines in all plots. ::: | SR ID | Primer Name | Amplification plots | Melt plots | |--------|--------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------| | 1385/6 | Cg_ATPsynthase | ![ATPsynthase amplification plots](sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54-ATPsynthase-amp-plots.png) | ![ATPsynthase melt plots](sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54-ATPsynthase-melt-plots.png) | | 1383/4 | Cg_HSP70 | ![HSP70 amplification plots](sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54-HSP70-amp-plots.png) | ![HSP70 melt plots](sam_2024-03-25_06-10-54-HSP70-melt-plots.png) | | 1172/3 | Cg_GAPDH_205 | ![GAPDH amplification plots](sam_2024-03-25_07-35-33-GAPDH-amp-plots.png) | ![GAPDH melt plots](sam_2024-03-25_07-35-33-GAPDH-melt-plots.png) | | 598/9 | Cg_Hsp90 | ![HSP90 amplification plots](sam_2024-03-25_07-35-33-HSP90-amp-plots.png) | ![HSP90 melt plots](sam_2024-03-25_07-35-33-HSP90-melt-plots.png) | | 1532/3 | Cg_cGAS | ![cGAS amplification plots](sam_2024-03-25_08-53-47-cGAS-amp-plots.png) | ![cGAS melt plots](sam_2024-03-25_08-53-47-cGAS-melt-plots.png) | | 1828/9 | Cg_VIPERIN | ![viperin amplification plots](sam_2024-03-25_08-53-47-viperin-amp-plots.png) | ![viperin melt plots](sam_2024-03-25_08-53-47-viperin-melt-plots.png) | | 1824/5 | Cg_citratesynthase | ![citrate synthase amplification plots](sam_2024-03-25_10-33-37-citrate_synthase-amp-plots.png) | ![citrate synthase melt plots](sam_2024-03-25_10-33-37-citrate_synthase-melt-plots.png) | | 1510/1 | Cg_DNMT1 | ![DNMT1 ampllification plots](sam_2024-03-25_10-33-37-DNMT1-amp-plots.png) | ![DNMT1 melt plots](sam_2024-03-25_10-33-37-DNMT1-melt-plots.png) |
